decks.notes: The main idea behind this deck is to control the game by countering threats and disrupting the opponent's game plan while ramping up mana with cards like Noble Hierarch and Green Sun's Zenith. The ultimate goal is to use Natural Order to tutor for Progenitus and close out the game quickly. The deck also includes versatile creatures like Vendilion Clique and Tarmogoyf to pressure the opponent and maintain board presence. Lightning Bolt provides additional removal and reach, while cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help with card selection and setting up the perfect plays.

The main focus of this deck is to quickly and efficiently dump high-value creatures into the graveyard using cards like Entomb and Careful Study, then reanimate them onto the battlefield with spells such as Animate Dead and Reanimate. The deck includes powerful creatures like Iona, Shield of Emeria and Jin-Gitaxias, Core Augur to quickly overwhelm the opponent. The deck also includes counterspells like Force of Will to protect your combo pieces and disruption like Daze to slow down your opponent's game plan. The mana base is designed to support the deck's strategies and ensure consistent mana production.

The deck revolves around quickly assembling Hive Mind and forcing the opponent to copy your game-ending spells with Pact of the Titan. Using a combination of fast mana sources and control elements like Force of Will, the goal is to overwhelm the opponent with powerful spells like Emrakul, the Aeons Torn. Show and Tell and Intuition are key cards for setting up the combo, while card selection cards like Brainstorm and Ponder help to find the pieces needed to win the game.

The deck is focused on utilizing aggressive Merfolk creatures to quickly overwhelm the opponent. With a combination of disruptive elements like Daze and Force of Will, along with creatures like Lord of Atlantis and Merrow Reejerey boosting each other's power, the strategy is to establish early board presence and maintain tempo throughout the game. Aether Vial allows for creatures to be put into play at instant speed, while cards like Kira, Great Glass-Spinner provide protection against removal spells. The deck also includes disruptive cards like Echoing Truth and Sower of Temptation to control the opponent's board.

The main concept of this deck is to control the game by using powerful control spells like Force of Will, Spell Snare, and Mental Misstep to disrupt your opponent's game plan. By shutting down your opponent's strategies, you can buy time to set up your win condition - using Stoneforge Mystic to search for powerful equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Body and Mind. With cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and Standstill, you can outvalue your opponent and slowly take over the game while managing the board with cards like Wasteland and Mishra's Factory.

The main concept of this Legacy Stoneblade deck is to control the game through powerful counter spells like Force of Will and Spell Snare, as well as removal spells like Swords to Plowshares. The deck also focuses on setting up strong board presence with creatures like Stoneforge Mystic and Grim Lavamancer, backed up by equipments like Batterskull and Sword of Feast and Famine. Additionally, the deck utilizes disruptive cards like Magus of the Moon to disrupt opponent's mana base. Overall, the deck aims to efficiently control the game while slowly grinding out a win.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game through a combination of counterspells, board wipes, and removal spells while using the synergy between Crucible of Worlds and various land cards to gain incremental advantage over the opponent. The deck aims to generate card advantage through cards like Ancestral Vision and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with counterspells like Counterspell and Force of Will. By utilizing the Landstill strategy, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and grind out a victory through superior resource management and control.

This control deck focuses on disrupting and controlling the opponent's plays while slowly building up its own board presence. Cards like Grim Lavamancer, Tarmogoyf, and Vendilion Clique provide threats while Jace, the Mind Sculptor offers card advantage and control. Ancestral Vision helps draw cards while countering spells with Force of Will and Spell Snare. The deck also has some removal options with Lightning Bolt and Beast Within. Overall, the deck aims to control the game through counterspells, removal, and card advantage to outvalue the opponent.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through card advantage and spell disruption while utilizing powerful equipment to pressure opponents. The Stoneblade archetype combines control elements such as Counterspells and removal spells with equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Body and Mind to create a versatile and resilient strategy. By using cards like Jace, the Mind Sculptor, Stoneforge Mystic, and Ancestral Vision, the deck aims to outvalue the opponent and establish a dominant board presence. Wasteland and Mishra's Factory provide additional disruption and utility in the deck's mana base.

The main focus of this Legacy Merfolk deck is to quickly establish a board presence with aggressive creatures like Coralhelm Commander and Lord of Atlantis, utilizing Aether Vial to cheat creatures into play and disrupt opponents with counterspells like Force of Will and Daze. Standstill can help control the pace of the game while Merrow Reejerey and Silvergill Adept provide additional synergy and card advantage. The deck aims to overwhelm opponents with fast, efficient creatures and disruption while maintaining control over the game.

This Merfolk deck focuses on aggressive plays and tempo control. By utilizing lords like Lord of Atlantis and Merrow Reejerey, along with disruptive creatures like Cursecatcher and Kira, Great Glass-Spinner, the deck aims to rapidly increase board presence and pressure opponents. Key cards like Aether Vial and Force of Will help to maintain momentum and protect against opposing threats. The inclusion of counterspells like Daze and Mental Misstep further adds to the deck's ability to disrupt the opponent's game plan. Mutavault and Wasteland provide additional utility and flexibility in managing the battlefield.

The main concept of this RUG control deck is to use a combination of counter spells, removal, and card draw to control the game until it can efficiently ramp into big threats like Tarmogoyf and Progenitus using Natural Order. The deck also utilizes cards like Vendilion Clique and Grim Lavamancer for additional disruption and pressure. The mana base is designed to ensure consistent access to all three colors of mana while also maximizing the efficiency of cards like Green Sun's Zenith. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition.

This deck is focused on aggressively disrupting the opponent with hand disruption spells like Hymn to Tourach and Thoughtseize, while also applying pressure with efficient threats like Dark Confidant, Stoneforge Mystic, and Bitterblossom. The deck aims to control the board by removing threats with Swords to Plowshares and Vindicate, while also generating card advantage and extra value with cards like Mirran Crusader and Elspeth, Knight-Errant. The mana base is designed to provide consistent access to all colors, with a mix of fetch lands, dual lands, and utility lands like Wasteland.

The main focus of this deck is to disrupt the opponent's strategy while maintaining a strong aggressive presence on the board. By utilizing a combination of efficient creatures like Tarmogoyf and Dark Confidant, along with disruptive spells like Stifle and Force of Will, the deck aims to control the game tempo and pressure the opponent into making suboptimal plays. This Aggro - BUG Midrange deck seeks to outpace opponents through a mix of disruption and efficient threats, ultimately leading to a victory through strategic decision-making and smart card choices.

The deck focuses on using a combination of creatures and disruptive spells to apply early pressure on the opponent while controlling the board. Dark Confidant and Tarmogoyf provide early threats, supported by removal spells like Go for the Throat and Hymn to Tourach. The deck also includes powerful Planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor for card advantage and control. The mana base includes a mix of dual lands and fetch lands for consistent mana fixing. Overall, the deck aims to maintain tempo, disrupt the opponent's game plan, and close out the game quickly with efficient creatures.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through powerful spells and disruptive cards such as Force of Will, Hymn to Tourach, and Mental Misstep. It also utilizes efficient creatures like Dark Confidant and Stoneforge Mystic to apply pressure and generate card advantage. With the ability to tutor for powerful equipment like Batterskull and Sword of Body and Mind, as well as removal spells like Swords to Plowshares and Vindicate, this deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver opponents while maintaining a strong board presence and disrupting their game plan.
